name: Zola Jesus
description:
'''Nika Roza Danilova''' (born '''Nicole Rose Hummel'''; April 11, 1989), known professionally by her [[stage name]] '''Zola Jesus''', is an American singer, songwriter, and record producer. Her music has been noted for combining elements of [[electronic music|electronic]], [[industrial music|industrial]], [[classical music|classical]], and [[gothic rock|goth]]. She is also the cousin of United States Senator [[Amy Klobuchar]].

Born in [[Phoenix, Arizona]], she spent her formative years in northern [[Wisconsin]], where she began writing and recording music independently while attending college. During her second year of studies, she released two singles through the independent label [[Sacred Bones Records|Sacred Bones]], followed by two [[Extended play|EPs]]. Her debut album,  ''[[The Spoils (Zola Jesus album)|The Spoils]]'', was released in 2009.

After graduating from the [[University of Wisconsinâ€“Madison]], she released her second full-length record, ''[[Stridulum II]]'' (2010), followed by ''[[Conatus (album)|Conatus]]'' (2011). Her fourth album, ''[[Taiga (Zola Jesus album)|Taiga]]'' (2014), released by [[Mute Records]], marked a departure from her previous releases, and featured a more prominent [[pop music|pop]]-influenced sound. Her fifth studio album, ''[[Okovi]]'', was released in 2017.
